title: Installation of go-based package create files outside of SPACK_ROOT

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
When installing some go-based packages, e.g. fzf or hugo I noticed that some files are created under $HOME/go, i.e. outside my Spack "path". 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
testuser@macbook-pro-de-laurent ~ % echo $SPACK_ROOT
/Users/testuser/github.com/spack/spack
testuser@macbook-pro-de-laurent ~ % ls $HOME
Desktop         Downloads       Movies          Pictures        github.com
Documents       Library         Music           Public
testuser@macbook-pro-de-laurent ~ % spack install hugo
testuser@macbook-pro-de-laurent ~ % ls
Desktop         Downloads       Movies          Pictures        github.com
Documents       Library         Music           Public          go
testuser@macbook-pro-de-laurent ~ % tree go -L 3
go
└── pkg
    └── mod
        ├── cache
        ├── cloud.google.com
        ├── github.com
        ├── go.opencensus.io@v0.22.0
        ├── gocloud.dev@v0.15.0
        ├── golang.org
        ├── google.golang.org
        └── gopkg.in
10 directories, 0 files
```

### Information on your system

testuser@macbook-pro-de-laurent ~ % spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1306-5604c8d91
* **Python:** 3.7.7
* **Platform:** darwin-catalina-skylake

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
